abstract: The head of the F.C.C. has proposed quick adoption of a rule that would prevent Comcast, the nation’s largest cable company, from growing larger.
snippet: The head of the F.C.C. has proposed quick adoption of a rule that would prevent Comcast, the nation’s largest cable company, from growing larger.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 — Coming off a setback at the hands of the cable television industry, the head of the Federal Communications Commission moved to reassert himself on Wednesday by proposing that the commission quickly adopt a rule that would prevent Comcast, the nation’s biggest cable company, from becoming larger, commission officials said.

headline.main: Size Limits for Cable Look Likely
headline.print_headline: Size Limits For Cable Look Likely

headline.main: F.C.C. Chief Moves to Limit Comcast and Help Tribune
